channel.title: development on OJ's Perspective
channel.description: Recent content in development on OJ's Perspective

item.title: N Things You Don't Want to Hear when Starting a New Job (where N >= 1)
item.description: Here are a collection of quotes that can drive fear into the heart of every developer. They’re made worse when heard at the start of a new gig, as any hope of a brave new world is smashed before you even get a login!

item.title: An All Too Common Issue
item.description: I think the following statement goes way deeper than it may have been intended (I might be wrong of course)… Engineering is about making tradeoffs. If you refuse to make the choice, then you’re taking the cowardly route and ultimately are creating more work for your team. Instead of solving problems, you’re creating them. All because you’re too chicken to make a hard decision. Thank you, Raymond Chen! You are a legend.
